intro: Wahlenbergia ericoidella, commonly known as the Ericoid Heath, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or alpine environments. It has a compact, low-growing habit with hairy leaves and is well adapted to harsh climatic conditions. Wahlenbergia ericoidella is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in heathland and scrub habitats.
